Importing packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(sf, tidyverse)
```
:::


Importing data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz14_shp = st_read(dsn = "/Users/andy/Desktop/IS415-VAA/In-class_Ex/In-class_Ex02/data/geospatial", layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")
```

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz19_shp = st_read(dsn = "/Users/andy/Desktop/IS415-VAA/In-class_Ex/In-class_Ex02/data/geospatial", layer =  "MPSZ-2019") %>% st_transform(crs = 3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
st_crs(mpsz19_shp) # to check the EPSG 3414
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: EPSG:3414 
  wkt:
```

```{.r .cell-code}
#go to epsg.io to find the crs system

```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz19_kml = st_read("/Users/andy/Desktop/IS415-VAA/In-class_Ex/In-class_Ex02/data/geospatial/MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `URA_MP19_SUBZONE_NO_SEA_PL' from data source 
  `/Users/andy/Desktop/IS415-VAA/In-class_Ex/In-class_Ex02/data/geospatial/MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY, XYZ
```

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#in the kml if the multiplygon is between 0 to 360 with decial point it is not in projected coordinate system
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata = read_csv("data/respopagesextod2023/respopagesextod2023.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 100928 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (5): PA, SZ, AG, Sex, TOD
dbl (2): Pop, Time

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2023 <- popdata %>%
  group_by(PA, SZ, AG) %>%
  summarise(POP = sum(Pop)) %>%
  ungroup()%>%
  pivot_wider(names_from= AG, 
              values_from=POP)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'PA', 'SZ'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
  colnames(popdata2023)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "PA"          "SZ"          "0_to_4"      "10_to_14"    "15_to_19"   
 [6] "20_to_24"    "25_to_29"    "30_to_34"    "35_to_39"    "40_to_44"   
[11] "45_to_49"    "50_to_54"    "55_to_59"    "5_to_9"      "60_to_64"   
[16] "65_to_69"    "70_to_74"    "75_to_79"    "80_to_84"    "85_to_89"   
[21] "90_and_Over"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  mutate_at(.vars = vars(PA, SZ), 
          .funs = list(toupper))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz_pop2023 <- left_join(mpsz19_shp, popdata2023, by = c("SUBZONE_N" = "SZ"))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pop2023_mpsz <- left_join(popdata2023, mpsz19_shp, by = c("SZ" = "SUBZONE_N"))
```
:::
